subject: Programming
title: The Human Factor in Failures
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Human Factor in Failures usable.

hook.text: Knight Capital's disaster started when a technician missed one server during deployment.

buildup.text: Humans make errors under time pressure, fatigue, and complexity. Software can't fix that alone.

discovery.text: Checklists, automation, and blameless postmortems reduce human error more than punishment does.

twist.text: Blaming individuals feels satisfying but misses systemic problems that caused the mistake.

climax.text: The best organizations treat every failure as a system design problem, not a people problem.

punchline.text: Blame the system, not the person.

quiz.question: What approach do the best organizations take after failures?
options: Treat them as system design problems
